abstract: Sasol oil company announces that global drop in oil prices is prompting it to delay $14 billion plant in southwestern Louisiana that would have converted natural gas into diesel; project required combination of high oil prices and low natural gas prices in order to be viable; retrenchment is largest since oil prices have fallen and exemplifies how oil companies are reconsidering many long-term, ambitious projects.
lead_paragraph: The $14 billion project, which had not received final approval from Sasol, was to begin production in 2018, creating some 1,200 permanent jobs.
snippet: The $14 billion project, which had not received final approval from Sasol, was to begin production in 2018, creating some 1,200 permanent jobs.

headline.main: Oil Company Sasol Delays Huge Louisiana Project as Prices Slide
headline.print_headline: Oil Company Delays Huge Louisiana Project as Prices Slide
